meanings.definition: to remove the wool from something
meanings.sent1: She carefully dewooled the sheep before summer.
meanings.sent2: The tailor dewooled the old sweater to make it lighter.
meanings.sent3: The sheep felt dewooled after its heavy coat was taken off.
meanings.sent4: The field looked dewooled after the sheep had grazed on it.
meanings.sent5: The act of dewooling made the fabric softer and more breathable.

meanings.sent1: The dewooled blanket was cool to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The dewooled sheep looked sleek and clean.
meanings.sent3: The dewooled sweater was perfect for the warm weather.
meanings.sent4: The dewooled coat felt light and comfortable.
meanings.sent5: The dewooled fabric was smooth and easy to care for.

meanings.sent1: She performed the dewooling of the sheep with skill.
meanings.sent2: The dewooling of the alpaca was done gently.
meanings.sent3: The dewooling process was quick and efficient.
meanings.sent4: The dewooling of the sheep was necessary for their health.
meanings.sent5: The sound of dewooling machines filled the shearing shed.
